column4: Anyone aware of how to connect to a linksys wireless router from ubuntu?
This has been the brunt of my passed few hours.
I have tried every combination of ndiswrapper.
Is that the Chipset?
I too am new to Ubuntu.
A few hours new.
go on firefox, and type this on the adress bar: 192.168.1.1  . I THINK you must be connected by a cable, not by wireless
where do I find the chip here (if that's what I am looking for)?
Oh :O I thought you needed to connect to the router, to configure it, not just to go online :( I'm sorry
sorry for the confusion, I'll reiterate: I have a Linksys WRT54G hooked up to this computer, and need to be able to access the internet it provides.
it really doesn't matter what router you've got, what you need to know is what your wireless card, or your ethernet card. to find out, you can type lshw -C network in the terminal
I understand, I hate using a cable too :) We got wireless cards for a reason! :)
okay, I took a bit here,
did it say what wireless card you've got?
this is mine: http://paste.ubuntu.com/107221/ see where it says Intel Wireless? It lists the model.  You could paste what you got, and we can tell you
I have nothing that says wireless interfact.
I have network UNCLAIMED, network, and network DISABLED.
oops
I don't know what to do from now, but maybe this could be usefull: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=890772
sorry if someone has already mentioned this, but, is this a fresh install of ubuntu? If so, have you checked for restricted drivers? System ->Administration->Hardware Drivers
ATI/AMD proprietary FGLRX graphics driver is the only one I see.
I can't find any help online that seems relevant :( Sorry
I haven't been able to either.
